Utterance: <sync>
Hi there! Welcome back. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been doing okay. I tried journaling once, but I didn’t keep up with it.
That’s alright! It’s all about finding what works for you. What was your experience like when you did journal?
I felt a bit awkward at first, but it was nice to get my thoughts out.
That’s a great start! It’s normal to feel awkward when trying something new. What do you think made it difficult to continue?
I think I just got busy and forgot about it.
Life can certainly get busy. Would it help to set a specific reminder for yourself?
Yes, I could set an alarm on my phone.
That’s a great idea! What time do you think would work best for you?
Maybe in the evenings after dinner.
Perfect! That could be a nice way to wind down your day. How about your mindfulness practice? Have you been able to incorporate that into your routine?
Yes, I’ve been doing it in the mornings. It really helps me start my day off right.
That’s fantastic! How have you noticed it impacting your day-to-day life?
I feel more centered and less anxious, especially when I start my day with it.
That’s wonderful to hear! Consistency can make a big difference. Have there been any challenges you’ve faced while practicing mindfulness?
Sometimes I still find my mind wandering, but I try to bring it back.

That’s completely normal. Mindfulness is a practice, and it’s okay if your mind wanders. The important thing is to gently guide it back. Would you like to explore any additional mindfulness techniques?
Sure, I’d love to learn more.
One technique is to focus on your senses. For example, when you’re outside, take a moment to notice what you see, hear, and feel. It can help ground you in the present moment.
I like that idea. I’ll try it next time I’m outside.
Great! Now, how did your plan to light a candle and reflect on your past relationship go?
I did it! It felt good to acknowledge those memories.
I’m glad to hear that. How did it feel to honor those memories in that way?
It felt cathartic. I cried a little, but I also felt a sense of closure.
That’s a powerful experience. It’s important to allow yourself to feel those emotions. Have you noticed any changes in how you view that relationship since then?
I think I’m starting to accept that it’s over.
Acceptance is a significant step in the healing process. What do you think is the next step for you in moving forward?
I want to focus on myself more and maybe explore new hobbies.
That sounds like a healthy approach. Have you looked into any crafting classes yet?
I found a few online, and I think I’ll sign up for one next week!
That’s exciting! Engaging in new activities can be a great way to meet people and build connections. How do you feel about that?
I feel hopeful. It’s nice to have something to look forward to.
That’s wonderful! Hope can be a powerful motivator. Is there anything else you’d like to discuss today?
I’ve been thinking about my job search again. I feel like I’m not making progress.
It’s normal to feel that way, especially in a competitive market. What steps have you taken since we last spoke?
I’ve applied to a couple more jobs, but I haven’t heard back yet.
Have you considered reaching out to any connections in your field? Networking can sometimes lead to opportunities.
I haven’t really thought about that. I’m not sure how to approach it.
Networking doesn’t have to be intimidating. You could start by sending a friendly message to someone you know, asking how they’ve been and if they have any advice.
That sounds manageable. I’ll give it a try.
Great! Let’s check in about that in our next session. Remember, it’s all about taking small steps.
Thank you for the encouragement. I appreciate it.
You’re welcome! I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s keep building on that momentum. Take care until next time!
Will do! Goodbye!
